column4: Malik, you houls be able to go to the Compiz site. The installation guide is in wiki form..
Or for simpler version of Compiz, provided you are using Feisty, you can go into system properties and enable desktop effects, which gives you the cube desktop and "wobble windows"
Malik, be fair warned, Compiz, depending on your system can be very unstable. Be ready for a crash of X-Org, and maybe the need to reload.
Master have you tried to sudo apt-get update / upgrade?
Many times if you hare having locking problems, the kernel update may help
Hmm, what are you system properties?
Houles, are you looking for a replacement desktop wallpaper, or to add extra desktops?
To add desktops, you can right click on the desktop switcher and add via the number choice..
Master, have you tried the dpkg command for driver selection?
i'm not sure what you mean.... do you mean dpkg-reconfigure x-server? if so.. yes
I am searching for a solution right now.. give me a moment, and I can see what I can find..
have you tried to use your windows drivers under wrapper or wine?
